clinical_study.brief_title: Measuring Motor Imagery Ability in Patients With Traumatic Brain Injury.
clinical_study.official_title: Measuring Motor Imagery Ability in Patients With Traumatic Brain Injury.

brief_summary.textblock:
1. Validation of translated Motor Imagery ability questionnaire MIQ-RS
2. Investigating the Motor Imagery ability in patients with traumatic brain injury

detailed_description.textblock:
1. Translation of the MIQ-RS following the WHO guidelines. Followed by a validation of this translated questionnaire in patients with traumatic brain injury and in healthy volunteers.
2. Investigating the motor imagery ability using 3 different test
- MIQ-RS (movement imagery questionnaire)
- TDMI (time dependent motor imagery)
- mental chronometry test
Patients and controls will perform all 3 test twice with an interval of 2 weeks to measure the test-retest reliability.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Comparison of 2 groups: one existing of patients with traumatic brain injury and one control group of healthy volunteers matched for age, sex and educational level

primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 assessments with an interval of 2 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Results of test battery assessing motor imagery ability

primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 assessments with an interval of 2 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Validity of the translated MIQ-RS in patients with traumatic brain injury and healthy volunteers

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 assessments with an interval of 2 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Test- retest reliability of the motor imagery ability test battery

arm_group.description: Patients who have suffered a traumatic brain injury will be assessed with a test battery including a motor imagery ability questionnaire (MIQ-rs) a mental rotation test a chronometry test (TDMI)

Healthy volunteers matched for age, sex and educational level will be assessed with the same test battery including a motor imagery ability questionnaire (MIQ-RS) a mental rotation test a chronometry test (TDMI)

intervention.intervention_name: Test battery to measure the motor imagery ability
intervention.description: Participants will perform 3 different tests to measure the motor imagery ability

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- TBI minimum 3 months ago and maximal 1 year ago
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other neurological disorders
- Severe cognitive deficits, unable to understand the study protocol
- Severe motor impairment, unable to perform the TDMI (Time Dependent Motor Imagery) screening test
Control group:
Matched for age, sex and educational level No neurological disorders present
